RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 1 5 1/2F Turf CR: 60. Maiden Special Weight Purse 38000. FOR ILLINOIS REGISTERED, CONCEIVED AND/OR FOALED. Maidens, Three Years Old and Upward. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: J J'S SOLUTION settled well off the early pace while racing three wide into the turn, launched his bid two out from the rail leaving the turn, and closed with a rush four wide in the stretch while taking control late, and quickly drawing clear. LONE RETURN settled off the early speed, while saving ground along the inside entering the turn, commenced his bid two wide leaving the turn, closed determinedly from along the rail in the drive, before shifting off the rail in deep stretch and finished gamely to get up for the place. PONCHO ATTACK tracked the pacesetter in the run to the turn while racing one out from the rail, rallied four wide leaving the turn, and closed willingly four wide in the drive to garner a share. TEMPLE FOOL unhurried early while trailing the field into the turn, commenced his bid four wide leaving the turn, and found his best stride late while closing three out from the rail in the drive. HAWAIIAN HIDE AWAY rushed to the lead one out from the rail in the early going, opened a clear advantage entering the turn, maintained his lead into the lane, but faded in the late stages. JAKES CHANNEL tracked the leader in the run to the turn while saving ground at the rail, rallied three wide through the turn, but was outfinished in the stretch drive. SMOOTH ATTACK tracked the leader three wide from between rivals in the run to the turn, checked while in tight quarters nearing the turn, rallied four wide through the turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. FLYING CRICKET tracked the leader four wide in the run down the backstretch, was carried wide entering the turn, and weakened over the final three eighths of a mile. This race was hand timed, due to technical issues

ENTRY.NAME: Jakes Channel
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, rallied 3 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Poncho Attack
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Lone Return
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside, rallied 2 wide, closed inside

ENTRY.NAME: Temple Fool
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 4 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Smooth Attack
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3w, checked 1/2, rallied 4 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Hawaiian Hide Away
ENTRY.COMMENT: led 2 wide, clear lead, late fade

ENTRY.NAME: J J's Solution
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide, led, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Flying Cricket
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 4 wide, carried 5 wide turn, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 2 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 85. Claiming Purse 15500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE APRIL 3 OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON THREE RACES SINCE SEPTEMBER 3, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race at a mile or over sinc e August 3 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Claiming races for $4,000 or less not considered in estimating allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BLURT away alertly and raced to the lead one out from the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace in the run down the backstretch, maintained a narrow lead through the turn, kicked clear entering the lane, and was never seriously threatened late. AVIANO stalked the leader two out from the rail in the run down the backside, rallied smartly three wide through the final turn, and closed willingly two out from the rail in the stretch drive to hold the place. GOLD BUCKLE tracked the leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, eased into a stalking trip in the run down the backside, launched his bid from just off the rail leaving the turn, and finished from along the inside in the drive to hang on for a share. BIG BLUE was off to an awkward start and trailed the field into the first turn, bided his time at the back of the field in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, saved ground through the turn, was pulled into the four path in mid stretch while laying in, and found his best stride late. MEMPHIS PRAYER stalked the leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, advanced two wide midway down the backside to take a tracking trip into the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response late when called upon. IOYA AGAIN settled well off the early pace while racing two out from the rail entering the backside, rallied two wide through the final turn, but failed to make a late impact while finishing from along the inside in the drive. CAIRO SUMMER was reluctant to load, but rushed up entering the first turn and forced the issue from the outside of BLURT entering the backstretch, forced the issue in the run to the final turn, but steadily retreated through the turn, and had nothing to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: Blurt
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led 2 wide, rallied inside, kicked clear

ENTRY.NAME: Gold Buckle
ENTRY.OWNER: Clabar Mor Stables LLC and Haran Thoroughbreds LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Memphis Prayer
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2w, advanced 1/2, rallied 2w, needed more late

ENTRY.NAME: Aviano
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 4 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Ioya Again
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed inside

ENTRY.NAME: Big Blue
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward start, trailed, rallied inside, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Cairo Summer
ENTRY.COMMENT: reluctant to load, pressed 3w, rallied 3w, steadily retreated

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 3 1M Turf CR: 68. Maiden Claiming Purse 19000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000. In the event that this race is taken off the turf it will be contested at One Mile and Seventy Yards on the main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: IN OPEN COURT raced into a stalking trip from along the rail in the run down the backstretch, launched his bid from along the inside through the final turn, assumed command entering the lane, and held the closers safely at bay late to prevail while finishing two wide in the drive. TEXAS PRINCESS settled well off the early pace while racing one out from the rail in the run down the backside, launched his bid three wide through the final turn, and finished determinedly two out from the rail in the drive to prove second best. DEE DEE B settled well off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the first time, was content to maintain his position in the run down the backstretch, commenced his bid from along the inside entering the final turn, and closed determinedly four wide in the drive to get up for a share in the final strides. LIMANI settled off the early pace while racing three wide in the run down the backstretch, commenced his bid from along the inside through the final turn, and finished two wide in the drive, but was outfinished late. MISS HIGH N MIGHTY rushed up to force the issue three wide entering the first turn, before easing into a tracking trip for the run down the backside, rallied two wide into the final turn, quickly assumed command when QUICK AND DIRTY was pulled up, was overtaken entering the lane, and outfinished in the drive. ARRINGTON away alertly, but was quickly taken in hand and allowed to settle at the back of the pack entering the first turn, bided his time in the run down the backside, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. LADY WHITE SOX away well and stalked the leaders into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide into the final turn, began to struggle midway through the turn, and wasn't persevered with while being eased in the stretch drive. QUICK AND DIRTY broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, held a clear advantage in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, appeared to take an awkward step midway through the turn, and was eased out of the race while pulling up, and was vanned off.

ENTRY.NAME: Arrington
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, rallied inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Quick and Dirty
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, pulled up, vanned off

ENTRY.NAME: Lady White Sox
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, eased

ENTRY.NAME: Limani
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: In Open Court
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Dee Dee B
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside, rallied rail, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Miss High N Mighty
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 3 wide, tracked 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Princess
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 4 5F Dirt CR: 70. Maiden Special Weight Purse 38000. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STEELER MISCHIEF tracked the leader in the run down the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied smartly three wide through the turn, drifted out seven wide in mid stretch under left handed urging, and quickly shifted in under right handed encouragement late, while being corrected in the final strides to get up in time. GAVEL tracked the leader into the turn while saving ground at the rail, slipped through along the inside to assume command in deep stretch and just failed to last. BANANA PLAN was fractious prior to the start, but got away well and controlled the pace into the turn while racing one out from the rail, and battled gamely two wide from between rivals in the lane, while holding on for a share. MIDTERM was slow into stride, but quickly rushed four wide into the turn while holding a tracking trip, rallied four wide leaving the turn, and finished determinedly three wide in the drive in a solid debut. JET FLIGHT stalked the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the turn, rallied three wide into the stretch, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. LAST MINUTE stalked the early pace four wide in the run to the turn, rallied three out from the rail leaving the turn, but failed to mount a late bid when asked. MALIBU BRAD unhurried early while dropping back to trail, rallied along the inside from the back of the pack entering the final turn, but failed to make a late impact. MAXIMUM COLOR tracked the pacesetter two wide into the turn, rallied three wide through the turn, but weakened in the stretch drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Gavel
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, rallied inside, closed rail, led, nipped

ENTRY.NAME: Jet Flight
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Maximum Color
ENTRY.OWNER: Robertson Hugh H and Pickerrell Joseph Anthony
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Last Minute
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 4 wide, rallied 4 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Steeler Mischief
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3w, rallied 3w, greenly, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Malibu Brad
ENTRY.OWNER: Wolfe Racing LLC and Robertson, Hugh H.
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Banana Plan
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious, led 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Midterm
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow into stride, tracked 4 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 3 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 5 5F Dirt CR: 70. Maiden Special Weight Purse 38000. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BAXLEY set a pressured pace in the run down the backstretch from the inside of EXCITABLE BOY, continued to battle with that rival through the turn, got the better of his pace rival entering the lane, and drew clear in the drive under confident handling. EXCITABLE BOY pressed the pace from the outside of BAXLEY in the run down the backside, continued to force the issue two wide through the turn, was unable to match strides with his pace rival entering the lane, but finished willingly three wide in the drive to prove clearly second best. KING ANTHONY settled off the contested early pace while racing two out from the rail in the run to the turn, rallied smartly four wide leaving the turn, and closed willingly three wide in the drive to get up for a share, while finding his best stride late. NEON DEION tracked the leaders in the run down the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, held a stalking trip behind the battling leaders into the final turn, rallied two wide leaving the turn, and finished evenly one out from the rail in the drive. METRONOME stalking the dueling leaders into the turn while racing one out from the rail, rallied along the inside leaving the turn, but was unable to mount a serious late bid while finishing at the rail in the drive. RED MOSCATO settled off the contested early pace while racing one out from the rail in the run down the backstretch, rallied five wide entering the final turn, and finished three wide in the drive in an even effort. BERABERABERA settled well off the dueling leaders in the run to the turn while racing four out from the rail, rallied five wide leaving the turn, but was unable to make his presence felt late. QUEBRANCHO stalked the leaders while racing four wide in the run to the turn, rallied two wide into the turn, but faded over the final three eights of a mile. POND was squeezed at the start, and trailed the field in the run down the backstretch, was always well back and failed to be a factor. MATRIX CODE settled well off the early pace while racing one out from the rail into the turn, was always well back and failed to make an impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Red Moscato
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 5 wide, closed 3 wide, even effort

ENTRY.NAME: Baxley
ENTRY.COMMENT: led rail, rallied inside, drew clear

ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, never menaced

ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.COMMENT: squeezed start, trailed, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Excitable Boy
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide, 2nd best

ENTRY.OWNER: Robertson Hugh H and Bera Anderson Melanie
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 5 wide, rallied 5 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 4 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 6 1M Turf CR: 90. Claiming Purse 26000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race at a mile or over on the turf since August 3 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000 (Claiming races for $16,000 or less not considered in es timating allowances). In the event that this race is taken off the turf it will be contested at One Mile and Seventy Yards on the main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: APRIL'S GEM away alertly and stalked the leader into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied smartly three wide leaving the final turn, and closed determinedly four wide in deep stretch to get up in the final strides. PRANCIPANTS tracked the leader into the first turn while saving ground at the rail, stalked the pacesetter in the run down the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied smartly two wide leaving the turn, assumed command in deep stretch and just failed to last. COMMAND POINT settled well off the early pace while saving ground entering the first turn, maintained her position in the run down the backside, launched her bid two wide entering the lane, and closed best of all five wide in the drive in a solid outing. TAPERINEA rushed to the lead while racing one out from the rail entering the first turn, opened a clear advantage in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, held a narrow lead into the lane, and gave way grudgingly late. MIZZEN ASH unhurried early while trailing the field into the first turn, bided her time at the back of the pack in the run down the backside, rallied four wide leaving the turn, and finished with late interest three out from the rail in the drive. WAY TOO SMARTE settled off the early pace while racing two wide entering the first turn, held her position in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide leaving the final turn, but was unable mount a serious late bid while finishing six wide in the drive. BLOODY MARY MORNIN settled off the early pave while racing two out from the rail entering the backstretch, commenced her bid two wide leaving the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. STACK SHACK stalked the early pace while racing two wide into the first turn, held a striking position in the run down the backstretch, but weakened over the final three eights of a mile.

ENTRY.NAME: April's Gem
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalk rail, rallied inside, closed 4 w, up in time

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Tony Holmes & Dr. & Mrs. Walter Zent

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 86. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 22000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $7,500 OR LESS IN 2021 - 2023 OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race since August 3 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming P rice $16,000 (Claiming races for $12,500 or less not considered in estimating allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SAMARITA away well and tracked the leader in the run to the turn while saving ground at the rail, rallied smartly two wide leaving the turn and into the lane, battled two wide from between rivals to mid stretch before taking command and quickly drawing clear as much the best. FIRST KITTEN broke sharply and stalked the leader in the run down the backside while racing one out from the rail, rallied three wide leaving the final turn, and closed steadily five wide in the drive to get up for the place. LONG TALL WOMAN tracked the pacesetter in the run down the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, launched her bid three wide leaving the turn, and closed willingly three wide in deep stretch to hold on for a share. STORMY EMPIRE settled off the early pace while saving ground along the inside entering the turn, commenced her bid from along the rail leaving the turn, and found her best stride late while splitting rivals nearing the wire. PRINCESS STELLA (IRE) away alertly and raced to the lead from just off the rail in the run down the backside, maintained her advantage through the turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive, but faded in deep stretch. CHAMPAGNE AFFAIR settled off the early pace while racing four wide in the run down the backstretch, raced at least five wide through the final turn, and was unable to make a late impact while finishing seven wide in the drive. MISS WINDY SLEW was bumped and squeezed between rivals at the start, before rushing to grab a stalking trip in the run to the turn, raced two wide into the turn while struggling to maintain her position, and steadily retreated.

ENTRY.NAME: Samarita
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked rail, rallied 2w, closed 2 w, led, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Windy Slew
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, squeezed start, stalked 2 wide, steadily retreated

ENTRY.NAME: Princess Stella (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, closed rail, late fade

ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside, rallied rail, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 4 wide, rallied 5 wide, never menaced

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 8 5 1/2F Turf CR: 92. Claiming Purse 18500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race since August 3 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500 (Claiming races for $6,250 or less not considered in estimating allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DRAGON DREW away alertly and dueled for the lead from the outside of LYRICAL POET in the run down the backstretch, continued to force the issue two wide from the outside of that rival into the turn, shook clear of his pace rival entering the lane, and quickly drew clear under confident handling. FOLLOW THE SIGNS settled well off the contested early pace while racing one out from the rail in the run down the backstretch, mounted a four wide bid leaving the turn, and closed steadily seven wide i the drive to get up for the place late. MALPAIS settled off the early pacesetters while racing three out from the rail in the run down the backstretch, launched his bid five wide leaving the final turn, and finished determinedly three out from the rail in the drive to garner a share. LYRICAL POET broke sharply and vied for the lead from the inside of DRAGON DREW in the run down the backstretch, continued to set a pressured pace from along the rail through the final turn, was unable to match strides with his pace rival leaving the turn, and was outfinished late for the minors. IDEA MAN settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail in the run down the backside, commenced his bid from along the inside leaving the turn, and finished with late interest four wide in the drive. D'ARCHER tracked the dueling leaders in the run down the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide leaving the turn, but faded in the late stages. GREELEYS ICE away well and tracked the dueling leaders in the run down the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, checked when in tight quarters midway through the turn, and failed to mount a serious late bid when called upon. AZRAEL tracked the dueling pacesetters three wide in the run down the backside, commenced a three wide bid leaving the turn, but was outfinished in the late going. HONEST TO GOODNESS was pinched at the start, and taken up while trailing the field in the run down the backstretch, was always well back and failed to make an impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Idea Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked rail, checked 5/16, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Honest to Goodness
ENTRY.COMMENT: pinched start, trailed throughout
